physical_examinations.relevant_findings: The patient was in mild distress. Oxygen saturation was normal. There were mild crackles in the lung bases. Facial atrophy was noted.

physical_examinations.vital_signs: ECG showed sinus rhythm at a rate of 60 beats per minute initially, then 54 beats per minute after recurrence of pain.
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Initial ECG showed premature atrial complexes and nonspecific ST-segment and T-wave changes. Repeated ECG showed ST-segment elevation in leads II, III, aVF, V5, and V6 and ST-segment depression in leads I, aVR, aVL, V1, V2, and V3.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: ECG changes progressed from nonspecific changes to ST-segment elevation and depression.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Initial levels of troponin I and CK-MB were negative for myocardial injury. On the second hospital day, CK level was 140 IU per liter, and CK-MB was positive.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Initially negative cardiac markers became positive on the second hospital day.
